intro: Anacheilium glumaceum, commonly known as the smooth-sheath grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that are typically green or pale in color. It is native to certain regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Anacheilium glumaceum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
